com.accele.gage.tile

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.tile.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Renderable, Tickable

    public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tickable, Renderable, Cleanable
    A wrapper class for holding texture and position information for tiles in a TileMap. Individual instances of this class are not designed to be created by the user; they are intended to be generated by the TileMap class.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tile(Texture texture, Vector2f position, Vector2f size)
      Constructs a new Tile instance with the specified texture, position, and size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(Texture texture,
            Vector2f position,
            Vector2f size)
        Constructs a new Tile instance with the specified texture, position, and size.
        Parameters:
        texture - the Texture to use for the tile
        position - the translation offset to use for the tile
        size - the normalized size vector to use for the tile

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(Graphics g,
                   double interpolation)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        Called as many times as possible per second to render the object. This method is designed to update object graphics only and should not be used to modify anything relating to object logic. getFps() returns the number of times per second this method will be called.
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        g - the instance of Graphics used by the engine to render objects
        interpolation - the normalized difference in time between when the previous frame was called and when this frame was called
        See Also:
        GameConfiguration

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from interface: Tickable
        Called a predetermined number of times per second to update the object. This method is designed to update game logic only and should not be used to modify anything relating to object rendering. getTicksPerSecond() returns the number of times per second this method will be called.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Tickable
        See Also:
        GameConfiguration

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Description copied from interface: Cleanable
        Allows the implementer to perform any necessary cleanup tasks. For most engine-specific resources, this method should not be called manually as it is usually always called after stop() has been called.
        Specified by:
        clean in interface Cleanable
